home.title: Find Earth
home.description: Help non-profit organizations and governments find missing people around the world.

about.whatIsIt:
What is it?

Find Earth is an open source platform, which aims to facilitate the reporting of lost people, speed up the viralization of their data in social networks and the most important: help to find them.
about.why:
Why?

When a person is lost, the time is worth more than normal. Through Find Earth you can report, view data and share lost people with just one click.

Usually we see tweets or facebook posts with the person information. This has some disadvantages. For example, we can't update a tweet. And if the tweet has already gone viral, it's too late.

Do we need a platform like this? Look at Argentina's statistics: in 27 days of April (2017), 28 femicides ocurred. Almost one femicide per day.

Source: http://cosecharoja.org/femicidio-araceli

When a person is lost, the first 72 hours are of the utmost importance to help find it. After this time the statistics are reduced unfavorably.

For us the awareness and collaboration of society is of the utmost importance since Find Earth is simply a tool, the medium is all of us.
